pokemon.description: Shuppet grows by feeding on dark emotions, such as vengefulness and envy, in the hearts of people. It roams through cities in search of grudges that taint people.

pokemon.name: Banette
pokemon.description: A cursed energy permeated the stuffing of a discarded and forgotten plush doll, giving it new life as Banette. The Pokémon's energy would escape if it were to ever open its mouth.

pokemon.name: Duskull
pokemon.description: Duskull wanders lost among the deep darkness of midnight. There is an oft-told admonishment given to misbehaving children that this Pokémon will spirit away bad children who earn scoldings from their mothers.

pokemon.name: Dusclops
pokemon.description: Dusclops absorbs anything, however large the object may be. This Pokémon hypnotizes its foe by waving its hands in a macabre manner and by bringing its single eye to bear. The hypnotized foe is made to do Dusclops's bidding.

pokemon.name: Tropius
pokemon.description: Children of the southern tropics eat as snacks the fruit that grows in bunches around the neck of Tropius. This Pokémon flies by flapping the leaves on its back as if they were wings.

pokemon.name: Chimecho
pokemon.description: In high winds, Chimecho cries as it hangs from a tree branch or the eaves of a building using a suction cup on its head. This Pokémon plucks berries with its long tail and eats them.

pokemon.name: Absol
pokemon.description: Absol has the ability to foretell the coming of natural disasters. It lives in a harsh, rugged mountain environment. This Pokémon very rarely ventures down from the mountains.

pokemon.name: Wynaut
pokemon.description: Wynaut gather on moonlit nights to play by squeezing up against each other. By being squeezed, this Pokémon gains endurance and is trained to dole out powerful counterattacks.

pokemon.name: Snorunt
pokemon.description: Snorunt survives by eating only snow and ice. Old folklore claims that a house visited by this Pokémon is sure to prosper for many generations to come.

pokemon.name: Glalie
pokemon.description: Glalie has the ability to freely control ice. For example, it can instantly freeze its prey solid. After immobilizing its prey in ice, this Pokémon enjoys eating it in leisurely fashion.

pokemon.name: Spheal
pokemon.description: Spheal always travels by rolling around on its ball-like body. When the season for ice floes arrives, this Pokémon can be seen rolling about on ice and crossing the sea.

pokemon.name: Sealeo
pokemon.description: Sealeo often balances and rolls things on the tip of its nose. While the Pokémon is rolling something, it checks the object's aroma and texture to determine whether it likes the object or not.

pokemon.name: Walrein
pokemon.description: Walrein swims all over in frigid seawater while crushing icebergs with its grand, imposing tusks. Its thick layer of blubber makes enemy attacks bounce off harmlessly.

pokemon.name: Clamperl
pokemon.description: Clamperl grows while being protected by its rock-hard shell. When its body becomes too large to fit inside the shell, it is sure evidence that this Pokémon is getting close to evolution.

pokemon.name: Huntail
pokemon.description: Huntail's tail is shaped like a fish. It uses the tail to attract prey, then swallows the prey whole with its large, gaping mouth. This Pokémon swims by wiggling its slender body like a snake.

pokemon.name: Gorebyss
pokemon.description: Although Gorebyss is the very picture of elegance and beauty while swimming, it is also cruel. When it spots prey, this Pokémon inserts its thin mouth into the prey's body and drains the prey of its body fluids.

pokemon.name: Relicanth
pokemon.description: Relicanth is a rare species that was discovered in deep-sea explorations. This Pokémon's body withstands the enormous water pressure of the ocean depths. Its body is covered in tough scales that are like craggy rocks.

pokemon.name: Luvdisc
pokemon.description: Luvdisc's heart-shaped body is a symbol of love and romance. It is said that any couple meeting this Pokémon is promised a loving relationship that never ends.

pokemon.name: Bagon
pokemon.description: Bagon harbors a never-ending dream of one day soaring high among the clouds. As if trying to dispel its frustration over its inability to fly, this Pokémon slams its hard head against huge rocks and shatters them into pebbles.

pokemon.name: Shelgon
pokemon.description: Covering Shelgon's body are outgrowths much like bones. The shell is very hard and bounces off enemy attacks. When awaiting evolution, this Pokémon hides away in a cavern.

pokemon.name: Salamence
pokemon.description: By evolving into Salamence, this Pokémon finally realizes its long-held dream of growing wings. To express its joy, it flies and wheels all over the sky while spouting flames from its mouth.

pokemon.name: Beldum
pokemon.description: Beldum keeps itself floating by generating a magnetic force that repels earth's natural magnetism. When it sleeps, this Pokémon anchors itself to a cliff using the hooks on its rear.

pokemon.name: Metang
pokemon.description: When two Beldum fuse together, Metang is formed. The brains of the Beldum are joined by a magnetic nervous system. This Pokémon turns its arms to the rear for traveling at high speed.

pokemon.name: Metagross
pokemon.description: Metagross is the result of two Metang achieving fusion. When hunting, this Pokémon pins the prey to the ground under its massive body. It then eats the helpless victim using the large mouth on its stomach.

pokemon.name: Regirock
pokemon.description: Regirock's body is composed entirely of rocks. Recently, a study made the startling discovery that the rocks were all unearthed from different locations.

pokemon.name: Regice
pokemon.description: Regice cloaks itself with frigid air of -328 degrees Fahrenheit. Things will freeze solid just by going near this Pokémon. Its icy body is so cold, it will not melt even if it is immersed in magma.

pokemon.name: Registeel
pokemon.description: Registeel was imprisoned by people in ancient times. The metal composing its body is thought to be a curious substance that is not of this earth.

pokemon.name: Latias
pokemon.description: Latias is highly intelligent and capable of understanding human speech. It is covered with a glass-like down. The Pokémon enfolds its body with its down and refracts light to alter its appearance.

pokemon.name: Latios
pokemon.description: Latios will only open its heart to a Trainer with a compassionate spirit. This Pokémon can fly faster than a jet plane by folding its forelegs to minimize air resistance.

pokemon.name: Kyogre
pokemon.description: Kyogre is said to be the personification of the sea itself. Legends tell of its many clashes against Groudon, as each sought to gain the power of nature.

pokemon.name: Groudon
pokemon.description: Through Primal Reversion and with nature's full power, it will take back its true form. It can cause magma to erupt and expand the landmass of the world.

pokemon.name: Rayquaza
pokemon.description: It flies forever through the ozone layer, consuming meteoroids for sustenance. The many meteoroids in its body provide the energy it needs to Mega Evolve.

pokemon.name: Jirachi
pokemon.description: Jirachi will awaken from its sleep of a thousand years if you sing to it in a voice of purity. It is said to make true any wish that people desire.

pokemon.name: Deoxys
pokemon.description: Deoxys emerged from a virus that came from space. It is highly intelligent and wields psychokinetic powers. This Pokémon shoots lasers from the crystalline organ on its chest.

pokemon.name: Turtwig
pokemon.description: It undertakes photosynthesis with its body, making oxygen. The leaf on its head wilts if it is thirsty.

pokemon.name: Grotle
pokemon.description: It knows where pure water wells up. It carries fellow Pokémon there on its back.

pokemon.name: Torterra
pokemon.description: Small Pokémon occasionally gather on its unmoving back to begin building their nests.

pokemon.name: Chimchar
pokemon.description: The gas made in its belly burns from its rear end. The fire burns weakly when it feels sick.

pokemon.name: Monferno
pokemon.description: It uses ceilings and walls to launch aerial attacks. Its fiery tail is but one weapon.

pokemon.name: Infernape
pokemon.description: It tosses its enemies around with agility. It uses all its limbs to fight in its own unique style.

pokemon.name: Piplup
pokemon.description: Because it is very proud, it hates accepting food from people. Its thick down guards it from cold.

pokemon.name: Prinplup
pokemon.description: It lives a solitary life. Its wings deliver wicked blows that can snap even the thickest of trees.

pokemon.name: Empoleon
pokemon.description: The three horns that extend from its beak attest to its power. The leader has the biggest horns.

pokemon.name: Starly
pokemon.description: They flock around mountains and fields, chasing after bug Pokémon. Their singing is noisy and annoying.

pokemon.name: Staravia
pokemon.description: It lives in forests and fields. Squabbles over territory occur when flocks collide.

pokemon.name: Staraptor
pokemon.description: When Staravia evolve into Staraptor, they leave the flock to live alone. They have sturdy wings.

pokemon.name: Bidoof
pokemon.description: It constantly gnaws on logs and rocks to whittle down its front teeth. It nests alongside water.

pokemon.name: Bibarel
pokemon.description: It makes its nest by damming streams with bark and mud. It is known as an industrious worker.

pokemon.name: Kricketot
pokemon.description: When its antennae hit each other, it sounds like the music of a xylophone.

pokemon.name: Kricketune
pokemon.description: It signals its emotions with its melodies. Scientists are studying these melodic patterns.

pokemon.name: Shinx
pokemon.description: All of its fur dazzles if danger is sensed. It flees while the foe is momentarily blinded.

pokemon.name: Luxio
pokemon.description: Strong electricity courses through the tips of its sharp claws. A light scratch causes fainting in foes.

pokemon.name: Luxray
pokemon.description: Luxray's ability to see through objects comes in handy when it's scouting for danger.

pokemon.name: Budew
pokemon.description: Over the winter, it closes its bud and endures the cold. In spring, the bud opens and releases pollen.

pokemon.name: Roserade
pokemon.description: With the movements of a dancer, it strikes with whips that are densely lined with poison thorns.

pokemon.name: Cranidos
pokemon.description: A lifelong jungle dweller from 100 million years ago, it would snap obstructing trees with headbutts.

pokemon.name: Rampardos
pokemon.description: Its skull is as hard as iron. It is a brute that tears down jungle trees while catching prey.

pokemon.name: Shieldon
pokemon.description: It was generated from a fossil dug out of a layer of clay that was older than anyone knows. It has a sturdy face.

pokemon.name: Bastiodon
pokemon.description: Any frontal attack is repulsed. It is a docile Pokémon that feeds on grass and berries.

pokemon.name: Burmy
pokemon.description: If its cloak is broken in battle, it quickly remakes the cloak with materials nearby.

pokemon.name: Wormadam
pokemon.description: When Burmy evolved, its cloak became a part of this Pokémon's body. The cloak is never shed.

pokemon.name: Mothim
pokemon.description: It flutters around at night and steals honey from the Combee hive.

pokemon.name: Combee
pokemon.description: It collects and delivers honey to its colony. At night, they cluster to form a beehive and sleep.

pokemon.name: Vespiquen
pokemon.description: Its abdomen is a honeycomb for grubs. It raises its grubs on honey collected by Combee.

pokemon.name: Pachirisu
pokemon.description: A pair may be seen rubbing their cheek pouches together in an effort to share stored electricity.

pokemon.name: Buizel
pokemon.description: It inflates the flotation sac around its neck and pokes its head out of the water to see what is going on.

pokemon.name: Floatzel
pokemon.description: Its flotation sac developed as a result of pursuing aquatic prey. It can double as a rubber raft.

pokemon.name: Cherubi
pokemon.description: It evolves by sucking the energy out of the small ball where it had been storing nutrients.

pokemon.name: Cherrim
pokemon.description: If it senses strong sunlight, it opens its folded petals to absorb the sun's rays with its whole body.

pokemon.name: Shellos
pokemon.description: Its shape and coloration vary, depending on its habitat.

pokemon.name: Gastrodon
pokemon.description: It apparently had a huge shell for protection in ancient times. It lives in shallow tidal pools.

pokemon.name: Ambipom
pokemon.description: To eat, it deftly shucks nuts with its two tails. It rarely uses its arms now.

pokemon.name: Drifloon
pokemon.description: These Pokémon are called the “Signpost for Wandering Spirits.” Children holding them sometimes vanish.

pokemon.name: Drifblim
pokemon.description: It's drowsy in daytime, but flies off in the evening in big groups. No one knows where they go.

pokemon.name: Buneary
pokemon.description: When it senses danger, it perks up its ears. On cold nights, it sleeps with its head tucked into its fur.

pokemon.name: Lopunny
pokemon.description: The ears appear to be delicate. If they are touched roughly, it kicks with its graceful legs.

pokemon.name: Mismagius
pokemon.description: Its cries sound like incantations to torment the foe. It appears where you least expect it.

pokemon.name: Honchkrow
pokemon.description: Becoming active at night, it is known to swarm with numerous Murkrow in tow.

pokemon.name: Glameow
pokemon.description: When it's happy, Glameow demonstrates beautiful movements of its tail, like a dancing ribbon.

pokemon.name: Purugly
pokemon.description: To make itself appear intimidatingly beefy, it tightly cinches its waist with its twin tails.

pokemon.name: Chingling
pokemon.description: There is an orb inside its mouth. When it hops, the orb bounces all over and makes a ringing sound.

pokemon.name: Stunky
pokemon.description: It protects itself by spraying a noxious fluid from its rear. The stench lingers for 24 hours.

pokemon.name: Skuntank
pokemon.description: It sprays a stinky fluid from its tail. The fluid smells worse the longer it is allowed to fester.

pokemon.name: Bronzor
pokemon.description: Implements shaped like it were discovered in ancient tombs. It is unknown if they are related.

pokemon.name: Bronzong
pokemon.description: Ancient people believed that petitioning Bronzong for rain was the way to make crops grow.

pokemon.name: Bonsly
pokemon.description: It prefers an arid atmosphere. It leaks water that looks like tears when adjusting its moisture level.

pokemon.name: Mime-Jr
pokemon.description: It habitually mimics foes. Once mimicked, the foe cannot take its eyes off this Pokémon.

pokemon.name: Happiny
pokemon.description: It carefully carries a round, white rock that it thinks is an egg. It's bothered by how curly its hair looks.

pokemon.name: Chatot
pokemon.description: It can learn and speak human words. If they gather, they all learn the same saying.

pokemon.name: Spiritomb
pokemon.description: It was bound to a fissure in an odd keystone as punishment for misdeeds 500 years ago.

pokemon.name: Gible
pokemon.description: It nests in small, horizontal holes in cave walls. It pounces to catch prey that stray too close.

pokemon.name: Gabite
pokemon.description: As it digs to expand its nest, it habitually digs up gems that it then hoards in its nest.

pokemon.name: Garchomp
pokemon.description: It flies at speeds equal to a jet fighter plane. It never allows its prey to escape.

pokemon.name: Munchlax
pokemon.description: It conceals food under the long fur on its body. It carts around this food stash and swallows it without chewing.

pokemon.name: Riolu
pokemon.description: The aura that emanates from its body intensifies to alert others if it is afraid or sad.

pokemon.name: Lucario
pokemon.description: By reading the auras of all things, it can tell how others are feeling from over half a mile away.

pokemon.name: Hippopotas
pokemon.description: It enshrouds itself with sand to protect itself from germs. It does not enjoy getting wet.

pokemon.name: Hippowdon
pokemon.description: It blasts internally stored sand from ports on its body to create a towering twister for attack.

pokemon.name: Skorupi
pokemon.description: It burrows under the sand to lie in wait for prey. Its tail claws can inject its prey with a savage poison.

pokemon.name: Drapion
pokemon.description: It has the power in its clawed arms to make scrap of a car. The tips of its claws release poison.

pokemon.name: Croagunk
pokemon.description: Inflating its poison sacs, it fills the area with an odd sound and hits flinching opponents with a poison jab.

pokemon.name: Toxicroak
pokemon.description: Its knuckle claws secrete a toxin so vile that even a scratch could prove fatal.

pokemon.name: Carnivine
pokemon.description: It binds itself to trees in marshes. It attracts prey with its sweet-smelling drool and gulps them down.

pokemon.name: Finneon
pokemon.description: After long exposure to sunlight, the patterns on its tail fins shine vividly when darkness arrives.

pokemon.name: Lumineon
pokemon.description: To avoid detection by predators, it crawls along the seafloor using the two fins on its chest.

pokemon.name: Mantyke
pokemon.description: When it swims close to the surface of the ocean, people aboard ships are able to observe the pattern on its back.

pokemon.name: Snover
pokemon.description: In the spring, it grows berries with the texture of frozen treats around its belly.

pokemon.name: Abomasnow
pokemon.description: It lives a quiet life on mountains that are perpetually covered in snow. It hides itself by whipping up blizzards.

pokemon.name: Weavile
pokemon.description: They live in cold regions, forming groups of four or five that hunt prey with impressive coordination.

pokemon.name: Magnezone
pokemon.description: It evolved from exposure to a special magnetic field. Three units generate magnetism.

pokemon.name: Lickilicky
pokemon.description: Their saliva contains lots of components that can dissolve anything. The numbness caused by their lick does not dissipate.

pokemon.name: Rhyperior
pokemon.description: It puts rocks in holes in its palms and uses its muscles to shoot them. Geodude are shot at rare times.

pokemon.name: Tangrowth
pokemon.description: Its vines grow so profusely that, in the warm season, you can't even see its eyes.

pokemon.name: Electivire
pokemon.description: It pushes the tips of its two tails against the foe, then lets loose with over 20,000 volts of power.

pokemon.name: Magmortar
pokemon.description: It blasts fireballs of over 3,600 degrees Fahrenheit out of its arms. Its breath also sears and sizzles.

pokemon.name: Togekiss
pokemon.description: It shares many blessings with people who respect one another's rights and avoid needless strife.

pokemon.name: Yanmega
pokemon.description: This six-legged Pokémon is easily capable of transporting an adult in flight. The wings on its tail help it stay balanced.

pokemon.name: Leafeon
pokemon.description: Just like a plant, it uses photosynthesis. As a result, it is always enveloped in clear air.

pokemon.name: Glaceon
pokemon.description: It lowers its body heat to freeze its fur. The hairs then become like needles it can fire.

pokemon.name: Gliscor
pokemon.description: Its flight is soundless. It uses its lengthy tail to carry off its prey... Then its elongated fangs do the rest.

pokemon.name: Mamoswine
pokemon.description: Its impressive tusks are made of ice. The population thinned when it turned warm after the ice age.

pokemon.name: Porygon-Z
pokemon.description: Its programming was modified to enable it to travel through alien dimensions. Seems there might have been an error...

pokemon.name: Gallade
pokemon.description: A master of courtesy and swordsmanship, it fights using extending swords on its elbows.

pokemon.name: Probopass
pokemon.description: It freely controls three small units called Mini-Noses using magnetic force.

pokemon.name: Dusknoir
pokemon.description: The antenna on its head captures radio waves from the world of spirits that command it to take people there.

pokemon.name: Froslass
pokemon.description: Legends in snowy regions say that a woman who was lost on an icy mountain was reborn as Froslass.

pokemon.name: Rotom
pokemon.description: Its body is composed of plasma. It is known to infiltrate electronic devices and wreak havoc.

pokemon.name: Uxie
pokemon.description: It is said that its emergence gave humans the intelligence to improve their quality of life.

pokemon.name: Mesprit
pokemon.description: It sleeps at the bottom of a lake. Its spirit is said to leave its body to fly on the lake's surface.

pokemon.name: Azelf
pokemon.description: It is thought that Uxie, Mesprit, and Azelf all came from the same egg.

pokemon.name: Dialga
pokemon.description: It has the power to control time. It appears in Sinnoh-region myths as an ancient deity.

pokemon.name: Palkia
pokemon.description: It has the ability to distort space. It is described as a deity in Sinnoh-region mythology.

pokemon.name: Heatran
pokemon.description: Boiling blood, like magma, circulates through its body. It makes its dwelling place in volcanic caves.

pokemon.name: Regigigas
pokemon.description: There is an enduring legend that states this Pokémon towed continents with ropes.

pokemon.name: Giratina
pokemon.description: It was banished for its violence. It silently gazed upon the old world from the Distortion World.

pokemon.name: Cresselia
pokemon.description: Those who sleep holding Cresselia's feather are assured of joyful dreams. It is said to represent the crescent moon.

pokemon.name: Phione
pokemon.description: It drifts in warm seas. It always returns to where it was born, no matter how far it may have drifted.

pokemon.name: Manaphy
pokemon.description: It starts its life with a wondrous power that permits it to bond with any kind of Pokémon.

pokemon.name: Darkrai
pokemon.description: It can lull people to sleep and make them dream. It is active during nights of the new moon.

pokemon.name: Shaymin
pokemon.description: The blooming of Gracidea flowers confers the power of flight upon it. Feelings of gratitude are the message it delivers.

pokemon.name: Arceus
pokemon.description: It is told in mythology that this Pokémon was born before the universe even existed.

pokemon.name: Victini
pokemon.description: When it shares the infinite energy it creates, that being's entire body will be overflowing with power.

pokemon.name: Snivy
pokemon.description: They photosynthesize by bathing their tails in sunlight. When they are not feeling well, their tails droop.

pokemon.name: Servine
pokemon.description: When it gets dirty, its leaves can't be used in photosynthesis, so it always keeps itself clean.

pokemon.name: Serperior
pokemon.description: It can stop its opponents' movements with just a glare. It takes in solar energy and boosts it internally.

pokemon.name: Tepig
pokemon.description: It loves to eat roasted berries, but sometimes it gets too excited and burns them to a crisp.

pokemon.name: Pignite
pokemon.description: When its internal fire flares up, its movements grow sharper and faster. When in trouble, it emits smoke.

pokemon.name: Emboar
pokemon.description: It has mastered fast and powerful fighting moves. It grows a beard of fire.

pokemon.name: Oshawott
pokemon.description: It fights using the scalchop on its stomach. In response to an attack, it retaliates immediately by slashing.

pokemon.name: Dewott
pokemon.description: As a result of strict training, each Dewott learns different forms for using the scalchops.

pokemon.name: Samurott
pokemon.description: One swing of the sword incorporated in its armor can fell an opponent. A simple glare from one of them quiets everybody.

pokemon.name: Patrat
pokemon.description: Extremely cautious, one of them will always be on the lookout, but it won't notice a foe coming from behind.

pokemon.name: Watchog
pokemon.description: When they see an enemy, their tails stand high, and they spit the seeds of berries stored in their cheek pouches.

pokemon.name: Lillipup
pokemon.description: Though it is a very brave Pokémon, it's also smart enough to check its foe's strength and avoid battle.

pokemon.name: Herdier
pokemon.description: It has black, cape-like fur that is very hard and decreases the amount of damage it receives.

pokemon.name: Stoutland
pokemon.description: Being wrapped in its long fur is so comfortable that a person would be fine even overnight on a wintry mountain.

pokemon.name: Purrloin
pokemon.description: They steal from people for fun, but their victims can't help but forgive them. Their deceptively cute act is perfect.

pokemon.name: Liepard
pokemon.description: Stealthily, it sneaks up on its target, striking from behind before its victim has a chance to react.

pokemon.name: Pansage
pokemon.description: It's good at finding berries and gathers them from all over. It's kind enough to share them with friends.

pokemon.name: Simisage
pokemon.description: Ill tempered, it fights by swinging its barbed tail around wildly. The leaf growing on its head is very bitter.

pokemon.name: Pansear
pokemon.description: This Pokémon lives in caves in volcanoes. The fire within the tuft on its head can reach 600 degrees Fahrenheit.

pokemon.name: Simisear
pokemon.description: When it gets excited, embers rise from its head and tail and it gets hot. For some reason, it loves sweets.

pokemon.name: Panpour
pokemon.description: The water stored inside the tuft on its head is full of nutrients. Plants that receive its water grow large.

pokemon.name: Simipour
pokemon.description: It prefers places with clean water. When its tuft runs low, it replenishes it by siphoning up water with its tail.

pokemon.name: Munna
pokemon.description: It eats the dreams of people and Pokémon. When it eats a pleasant dream, it expels pink-colored mist.

pokemon.name: Musharna
pokemon.description: The dream mist coming from its forehead changes into many different colors depending on the dream that was eaten.

pokemon.name: Pidove
pokemon.description: These Pokémon live in cities. They are accustomed to people. Flocks often gather in parks and plazas.

pokemon.name: Tranquill
pokemon.description: No matter where in the world it goes, it knows where its nest is, so it never gets separated from its Trainer.

pokemon.name: Unfezant
pokemon.description: Males have plumage on their heads. They will never let themselves feel close to anyone other than their Trainers.

pokemon.name: Blitzle
pokemon.description: Its mane shines when it discharges electricity. They use the frequency and rhythm of these flashes to communicate.

pokemon.name: Zebstrika
pokemon.description: They have lightning-like movements. When Zebstrika run at full speed, the sound of thunder reverberates.

pokemon.name: Roggenrola
pokemon.description: They were discovered a hundred years ago in an earthquake fissure. Inside each one is an energy core.

pokemon.name: Boldore
pokemon.description: When it is healthy, its core sticks out. Always facing the same way, it swiftly moves front to back and left to right.

pokemon.name: Gigalith
pokemon.description: Compressing the energy from its internal core lets it fire off an attack capable of blowing away a mountain.

pokemon.name: Woobat
pokemon.description: The heart-shaped mark left on a body after a Woobat has been attached to it is said to bring good fortune.

pokemon.name: Swoobat
pokemon.description: Anyone who comes into contact with the ultrasonic waves emitted by a courting male experiences a positive mood shift.

pokemon.name: Drilbur
pokemon.description: By spinning its body, it can dig straight through the ground at a speed of 30 mph.

pokemon.name: Excadrill
pokemon.description: More than 300 feet below the surface, they build mazelike nests. Their activity can be destructive to subway tunnels.

pokemon.name: Audino
pokemon.description: It touches others with the feelers on its ears, using the sound of their heartbeats to tell how they are feeling.

pokemon.name: Timburr
pokemon.description: Always carrying squared logs, they help out with construction. As they grow, they carry bigger logs.

pokemon.name: Gurdurr
pokemon.description: This Pokémon is so muscular and strongly built that even a group of wrestlers could not make it budge an inch.

pokemon.name: Conkeldurr
pokemon.description: Rather than rely on force, they master moves that utilize the centrifugal force of spinning concrete.

pokemon.name: Tympole
pokemon.description: By vibrating its cheeks, it emits sound waves imperceptible to humans. It uses the rhythm of these sounds to talk.

pokemon.name: Palpitoad
pokemon.description: It lives in the water and on land. It uses its long, sticky tongue to immobilize its opponents.

pokemon.name: Seismitoad
pokemon.description: They shoot paralyzing liquid from their head bumps. They use vibration to hurt their opponents.

pokemon.name: Throh
pokemon.description: When it encounters a foe bigger than itself, it wants to throw it. It changes belts as it gets stronger.

pokemon.name: Sawk
pokemon.description: Tying their belts gets them pumped and makes their punches more destructive. Disturbing their training angers them.

pokemon.name: Sewaddle
pokemon.description: Since this Pokémon makes its own clothes out of leaves, it is a popular mascot for fashion designers.

pokemon.name: Swadloon
pokemon.description: It protects itself from the cold by wrapping up in leaves. It stays on the move, eating leaves in forests.

pokemon.name: Leavanny
pokemon.description: It keeps its eggs warm with heat from fermenting leaves. It also uses leaves to make warm wrappings for Sewaddle.

pokemon.name: Venipede
pokemon.description: Its bite injects a potent poison, enough to paralyze large bird Pokémon that try to prey on it.

pokemon.name: Whirlipede
pokemon.description: It is usually motionless, but when attacked, it rotates at high speed and then crashes into its opponent.

pokemon.name: Scolipede
pokemon.description: With quick movements, it chases down its foes, attacking relentlessly with its horns until it prevails.

pokemon.name: Cottonee
pokemon.description: Perhaps because they feel more at ease in a group, they stick to others they find. They end up looking like a cloud.

pokemon.name: Whimsicott
pokemon.description: Like the wind, it can slip through any gap, no matter how small. It leaves balls of white fluff behind.

pokemon.name: Petilil
pokemon.description: Since they prefer moist, nutrient-rich soil, the areas where Petilil live are known to be good for growing plants.

pokemon.name: Lilligant
pokemon.description: Even veteran Trainers face a challenge in getting its beautiful flower to bloom. This Pokémon is popular with celebrities.

pokemon.name: Basculin
pokemon.description: Red and blue Basculin usually do not get along, but sometimes members of one school mingle with the other's school.

pokemon.name: Sandile
pokemon.description: They live buried in the sands of the desert. The sun-warmed sands prevent their body temperature from dropping.

pokemon.name: Krokorok
pokemon.description: The special membrane covering its eyes can sense the heat of objects, so it can see its surroundings even in darkness.

pokemon.name: Krookodile
pokemon.description: They never allow prey to escape. Their jaws are so powerful, they can crush the body of an automobile.

pokemon.name: Darumaka
pokemon.description: When it sleeps, it pulls its limbs into its body and its internal fire goes down to 1,100 degrees Fahrenheit.

pokemon.name: Darmanitan
pokemon.description: Its internal fire burns at 2,500 degrees Fahrenheit,  making enough power that it can destroy a dump  truck with one punch.

pokemon.name: Maractus
pokemon.description: Arid regions are their habitat. They move  rhythmically, making a sound similar to maracas.

pokemon.name: Dwebble
pokemon.description: When it finds a stone of a suitable size, it secretes  a liquid from its mouth to open up a hole to  crawl into.

pokemon.name: Crustle
pokemon.description: Competing for territory, Crustle fight viciously.  The one whose boulder is broken is the loser of  the battle.

pokemon.name: Scraggy
pokemon.description: Proud of its sturdy skull, it suddenly headbutts  everything, but its weight makes it unstable, too.

pokemon.name: Scrafty
pokemon.description: It can smash concrete blocks with its kicking  attacks. The one with the biggest crest is the  group leader.

pokemon.name: Sigilyph
pokemon.description: The guardians of an ancient city, they always fly  the same route while keeping watch for invaders.

pokemon.name: Yamask
pokemon.description: Each of them carries a mask that used to be its face  when it was human. Sometimes they look at it  and cry.

pokemon.name: Cofagrigus
pokemon.description: Grave robbers who mistake them for real coffins and  get too close end up trapped inside their bodies.

pokemon.name: Tirtouga
pokemon.description: Restored from a fossil, this Pokémon can dive to  depths beyond half a mile.

pokemon.name: Carracosta
pokemon.description: It could knock out a foe with a slap from one of its  developed front appendages and chew it up, shell  or bones and all.

pokemon.name: Archen
pokemon.description: Said to be an ancestor of bird Pokémon, they were  unable to fly and moved about by hopping from one  branch to another.

pokemon.name: Archeops
pokemon.description: It runs better than it flies. It takes off into the sky  by running at a speed of 25 mph.

pokemon.name: Trubbish
pokemon.description: Inhaling the gas they belch will make you sleep for  a week. They prefer unsanitary places.

pokemon.name: Garbodor
pokemon.description: Consuming garbage makes new kinds of poison  gases and liquids inside their bodies.

pokemon.name: Zorua
pokemon.description: To protect themselves from danger, they hide their  true identities by transforming into people  and Pokémon.

pokemon.name: Zoroark
pokemon.description: Bonds between these Pokémon are very strong.  It protects the safety of its pack by tricking  its opponents.

pokemon.name: Minccino
pokemon.description: These Pokémon prefer a tidy habitat. They are  always sweeping and dusting, using their tails  as brooms.

pokemon.name: Cinccino
pokemon.description: Cinccino's body is coated in a special oil that helps  it deflect attacks, such as punches.

pokemon.name: Gothita
pokemon.description: They intently observe both Trainers and Pokémon.  Apparently, they are looking at something that only  Gothita can see.

pokemon.name: Gothorita
pokemon.description: According to many old tales, it creates friends for  itself by controlling sleeping children on  starry nights.

pokemon.name: Gothitelle
pokemon.description: They can predict the future from the placement and  movement of the stars. They can see Trainers'  life spans.

pokemon.name: Solosis
pokemon.description: They drive away attackers by unleashing psychic  power. They can use telepathy to talk with others.

pokemon.name: Duosion
pokemon.description: When their two divided brains think the same  thoughts, their psychic power is maximized.

pokemon.name: Reuniclus
pokemon.description: When Reuniclus shake hands, a network forms  between their brains, increasing their  psychic power.

pokemon.name: Ducklett
pokemon.description: They are better at swimming than flying, and they  happily eat their favorite food, peat moss, as they  dive underwater.

pokemon.name: Swanna
pokemon.description: Swanna start to dance at dusk. The one dancing in  the middle is the leader of the flock.

pokemon.name: Vanillite
pokemon.description: This Pokémon formed from icicles bathed in energy  from the morning sun. It sleeps buried in snow.

pokemon.name: Vanillish
pokemon.description: Snowy mountains are this Pokémon's habitat.  During an ancient ice age, they moved to  southern areas.

pokemon.name: Vanilluxe
pokemon.description: Swallowing large amounts of water, they make  snow clouds inside their bodies and, when angry,  cause violent blizzards.

pokemon.name: Deerling
pokemon.description: The turning of the seasons changes the color and scent of this Pokémon's fur. People use it to mark the seasons.

pokemon.name: Sawsbuck
pokemon.description: They migrate according to the seasons, so some people call Sawsbuck the harbingers of spring.

pokemon.name: Emolga
pokemon.description: The energy made in its cheeks' electric pouches is stored inside its membrane and released while it is gliding.

pokemon.name: Karrablast
pokemon.description: For some reason they evolve when they receive electrical energy while they are attacking Shelmet.

pokemon.name: Escavalier
pokemon.description: These Pokémon evolve by wearing the shell covering of a Shelmet. The steel armor protects their whole body.

pokemon.name: Foongus
pokemon.description: It lures Pokémon with its pattern that looks just like a Poké Ball, then releases poison spores.

pokemon.name: Amoonguss
pokemon.description: It lures prey close by dancing and waving its arm caps, which resemble Poké Balls, in a swaying motion.

pokemon.name: Frillish
pokemon.description: If its veil-like arms stun and wrap a foe, that foe will be dragged miles below the surface, never to return.

pokemon.name: Jellicent
pokemon.description: The fate of the ships and crew that wander into Jellicent's habitat: all sunken, all lost, all vanished.

pokemon.name: Alomomola
pokemon.description: It gently holds injured and weak Pokémon in its fins. Its special membrane heals their wounds.

pokemon.name: Joltik
pokemon.description: They attach themselves to large-bodied Pokémon and absorb static electricity, which they store in an electric pouch.

pokemon.name: Galvantula
pokemon.description: When attacked, they create an electric barrier by spitting out many electrically charged threads.

pokemon.name: Ferroseed
pokemon.description: It absorbs the iron it finds in the rock while clinging to the ceiling. It shoots spikes when in danger.

pokemon.name: Ferrothorn
pokemon.description: They attach themselves to cave ceilings, firing steel spikes at targets passing beneath them.

pokemon.name: Klink
pokemon.description: The two minigears that mesh together are predetermined. Each will rebound from other minigears without meshing.

pokemon.name: Klang
pokemon.description: A minigear and big gear comprise its body. If the minigear it launches at a foe doesn't return, it will die.

pokemon.name: Klinklang
pokemon.description: Its red core functions as an energy tank. It fires the charged energy through its spikes into an area.

pokemon.name: Tynamo
pokemon.description: One alone can emit only a trickle of electricity, so a group of them gathers to unleash a powerful electric shock.

pokemon.name: Eelektrik
pokemon.description: These Pokémon have a big appetite. When they spot their prey, they attack it and paralyze it with electricity.

pokemon.name: Eelektross
pokemon.description: They crawl out of the ocean using their arms. They will attack prey on shore and immediately drag it into the ocean.

pokemon.name: Elgyem
pokemon.description: Rumors of its origin are linked to a UFO crash site in the desert 50 years ago.

pokemon.name: Beheeyem
pokemon.description: It uses psychic power to control an opponent's brain and tamper with its memories.

pokemon.name: Litwick
pokemon.description: Litwick shines a light that absorbs the life energy of people and Pokémon, which becomes the fuel that it burns.

pokemon.name: Lampent
pokemon.description: It arrives near the moment of death and steals spirit from the body.

pokemon.name: Chandelure
pokemon.description: The spirits burned up in its ominous flame lose their way and wander this world forever.

pokemon.name: Axew
pokemon.description: They mark their territory by leaving gashes in trees with their tusks. If a tusk breaks, a new one grows in quickly.

pokemon.name: Fraxure
pokemon.description: A broken tusk will not grow back, so it diligently sharpens its tusks on river rocks after the end of a battle.

pokemon.name: Haxorus
pokemon.description: Their sturdy tusks will stay sharp even if used to cut steel beams. These Pokémon are covered in hard armor.

pokemon.name: Cubchoo
pokemon.description: Their snot is a barometer of health. When healthy, their snot is sticky and the power of their ice moves increases.

pokemon.name: Beartic
pokemon.description: It freezes its breath to create fangs and claws of ice to fight with. Cold northern areas are its habitat.

pokemon.name: Cryogonal
pokemon.description: They are composed of ice crystals. They capture prey with chains of ice, freezing the prey at -148 degrees Fahrenheit.

pokemon.name: Shelmet
pokemon.description: It evolves when bathed in an electric-like energy along with Karrablast. The reason is still unknown.

pokemon.name: Accelgor
pokemon.description: When its body dries out, it weakens. So, to prevent dehydration, it wraps itself in many layers of thin membrane.

pokemon.name: Stunfisk
pokemon.description: It conceals itself in the mud of the seashore. Then it waits. When prey touch it, it delivers a jolt of electricity.

pokemon.name: Mienfoo
pokemon.description: In fights, they dominate with onslaughts of flowing, continuous attacks. With their sharp claws, they cut enemies.

pokemon.name: Mienshao
pokemon.description: Using the long fur on its arms like whips, it launches into combo attacks that, once started, no one can stop.

pokemon.name: Druddigon
pokemon.description: It warms its body by absorbing sunlight with its wings. When its body temperature falls, it can no longer move.

pokemon.name: Golett
pokemon.description: Ancient science fashioned this Pokémon from clay. It's been active for thousands of years.

pokemon.name: Golurk
pokemon.description: It flies across the sky at Mach speeds. Removing the seal on its chest makes its internal energy go out of control.

pokemon.name: Pawniard
pokemon.description: Ignoring their injuries, groups attack by sinking the blades that cover their bodies into their prey.

pokemon.name: Bisharp
pokemon.description: Bisharp pursues prey in the company of a large group of Pawniard. Then Bisharp finishes off the prey.

pokemon.name: Bouffalant
pokemon.description: Their fluffy fur absorbs damage, even if they strike foes with a fierce headbutt.

pokemon.name: Rufflet
pokemon.description: They will challenge anything, even strong opponents, without fear. Their frequent fights help them become stronger.

pokemon.name: Braviary
pokemon.description: They fight for their friends without any thought about danger to themselves. One can carry a car while flying.

pokemon.name: Vullaby
pokemon.description: Their wings are too tiny to allow them to fly. They guard their posteriors with bones that were gathered by Mandibuzz.

pokemon.name: Mandibuzz
pokemon.description: Watching from the sky, they swoop to strike weakened Pokémon on the ground. They decorate themselves with bones.

pokemon.name: Heatmor
pokemon.description: It draws in air through its tail, transforms it into fire, and uses it like a tongue. It melts Durant and eats them.

pokemon.name: Durant
pokemon.description: They attack in groups, covering themselves in steel armor to protect themselves from Heatmor.

pokemon.name: Deino
pokemon.description: Lacking sight, it's unaware of its surroundings, so it bumps into things and eats anything that moves.

pokemon.name: Zweilous
pokemon.description: After it has eaten up all the food in its territory, it moves to another area. Its two heads do not get along.

pokemon.name: Hydreigon
pokemon.description: It responds to movement by attacking. This scary, three-headed Pokémon devours everything in its path!

pokemon.name: Larvesta
pokemon.description: The base of volcanoes is where they make their homes. They shoot fire from their five horns to repel attacking enemies.

pokemon.name: Volcarona
pokemon.description: When volcanic ash darkened the atmosphere, it is said that Volcarona's fire provided a replacement for the sun.

pokemon.name: Cobalion
pokemon.description: It has a body and heart of steel. It worked with its allies to punish people when they hurt Pokémon.

pokemon.name: Terrakion
pokemon.description: Spoken of in legend, this Pokémon used its phenomenal power to destroy a castle in its effort to protect Pokémon.

pokemon.name: Virizion
pokemon.description: Legends say this Pokémon confounded opponents with its swift movements.

pokemon.name: Tornadus
pokemon.description: Tornadus expels massive energy from its tail, causing severe storms. Its power is great enough to blow houses away.

pokemon.name: Thundurus
pokemon.description: As it flies around, it shoots lightning all over the place and causes forest fires. It is therefore disliked.

pokemon.name: Reshiram
pokemon.description: When Reshiram's tail flares, the heat energy moves the atmosphere and changes the world's weather.

pokemon.name: Zekrom
pokemon.description: Concealing itself in lightning clouds, it flies throughout the Unova region. It creates electricity in its tail.

pokemon.name: Landorus
pokemon.description: From the forces of lightning and wind, it creates energy to give nutrients to the soil and make the land abundant.

pokemon.name: Kyurem
pokemon.description: It generates a powerful, freezing energy inside itself, but its body became frozen when the energy leaked out.

pokemon.name: Keldeo
pokemon.description: When it is resolute, its body fills with power and it becomes swifter. Its jumps are then too fast to follow.

pokemon.name: Meloetta
pokemon.description: Its melodies are sung with a special vocalization method that can control the feelings of those who hear it.

pokemon.name: Genesect
pokemon.description: This Pokémon existed 300 million years ago. Team Plasma altered it and attached a cannon to its back.

pokemon.name: Chespin
pokemon.description: Such a thick shell of wood covers its head and back that even a direct hit from a truck wouldn't faze it.

pokemon.name: Quilladin
pokemon.description: They strengthen their lower bodies by running into one another. They are very kind and won't start fights.

pokemon.name: Chesnaught
pokemon.description: When it takes a defensive posture with its fists guarding its face, it could withstand a bomb blast.

pokemon.name: Fennekin
pokemon.description: As it walks, it munches on a twig in place of a snack. It intimidates opponents by puffing hot air out of its ears.

pokemon.name: Braixen
pokemon.description: When the twig is plucked from its tail, friction sets the twig alight. The flame is used to send signals to its allies.

pokemon.name: Delphox
pokemon.description: Using psychic power, it generates a fiery vortex of 5,400 degrees Fahrenheit, incinerating foes swept into this whirl of flame.

pokemon.name: Froakie
pokemon.description: It protects its skin by covering its body in delicate bubbles. Beneath its happy-go-lucky air, it keeps a watchful eye on its surroundings.

pokemon.name: Frogadier
pokemon.description: Its swiftness is unparalleled. It can scale a tower of more than 2,000 feet in a minute's time.

pokemon.name: Greninja
pokemon.description: It appears and vanishes with a ninja's grace. It toys with its enemies using swift movements, while slicing them with throwing stars of sharpest water.

pokemon.name: Bunnelby
pokemon.description: It has ears like shovels. Digging holes strengthens its ears so much that they can sever thick roots effortlessly.

pokemon.name: Diggersby
pokemon.description: As powerful as an excavator, its ears can reduce dense bedrock to rubble. When it's finished digging, it lounges lazily.

pokemon.name: Fletchling
pokemon.description: Despite the beauty of its lilting voice, it's merciless to intruders that enter its territory.

pokemon.name: Fletchinder
pokemon.description: The hotter the flame sac on its belly, the faster it can fly, but it takes some time to get the fire going.

pokemon.name: Talonflame
pokemon.description: When attacking prey, it can reach speeds of up to 310 mph. It finishes its prey off with a colossal kick.

pokemon.name: Scatterbug
pokemon.description: The powder that covers its body regulates its temperature, so it can live in any region or climate.

pokemon.name: Spewpa
pokemon.description: The beaks of bird Pokémon can't begin to scratch its stalwart body. To defend itself, it spews powder.

pokemon.name: Vivillon
pokemon.description: The patterns on this Pokémon's wings depend on the climate and topography of its habitat. It scatters colorful scales.

pokemon.name: Litleo
pokemon.description: They set off on their own from their pride and live by themselves to become stronger. These hot-blooded Pokémon are quick to fight.

pokemon.name: Pyroar
pokemon.description: With fiery breath of more than 10,000 degrees Fahrenheit, they viciously threaten any challenger. The females protect the pride's cubs.

pokemon.name: Flabebe
pokemon.description: When it finds a flower it likes, it dwells on that flower its whole life long. It floats in the wind's embrace with an untroubled heart.

pokemon.name: Floette
pokemon.description: When the flowers of a well-tended flower bed bloom, it appears and celebrates with an elegant dance.

pokemon.name: Florges
pokemon.description: In times long past, governors of castles would invite Florges to create flower gardens to embellish the castle domains.

pokemon.name: Skiddo
pokemon.description: If it has sunshine and water, it doesn't need to eat, because it can generate energy from the leaves on its back.

pokemon.name: Gogoat
pokemon.description: They inhabit mountainous regions. The leader of the herd is decided by a battle of clashing horns.

pokemon.name: Pancham
pokemon.description: It does its level best to glare and pull a scary face, but it can't help grinning if anyone pats its head.

pokemon.name: Pangoro
pokemon.description: It charges ahead and bashes its opponents like a berserker, uncaring about any hits it might take. Its arms are mighty enough to snap a telephone pole.

pokemon.name: Furfrou
pokemon.description: Historically, in the Kalos region, these Pokémon were the designated guardians of the king.

pokemon.name: Espurr
pokemon.description: It has enough psychic energy to blast everything within 300 feet of itself, but it has no control over its power.

pokemon.name: Meowstic
pokemon.description: The eyeball patterns on the interior of its ears emit psychic energy. It keeps the patterns tightly covered because that power is too immense.

pokemon.name: Honedge
pokemon.description: If anyone dares to grab its hilt, it wraps a blue cloth around that person's arm and drains that person's life energy completely.

pokemon.name: Doublade
pokemon.description: The complex attack patterns of its two swords are unstoppable, even for an opponent greatly accomplished at swordplay.

pokemon.name: Aegislash
pokemon.description: Apparently, it can detect the innate qualities of leadership. According to legend, whoever it recognizes is destined to become king.

pokemon.name: Spritzee
pokemon.description: In the past, rather than using perfume, royal ladies carried a Spritzee that would waft a fragrance they liked.

pokemon.name: Aromatisse
pokemon.description: Its scent is so overpowering that, unless a Trainer happens to really enjoy the smell, he or she will have a hard time walking alongside it.

pokemon.name: Swirlix
pokemon.description: Because it eats nothing but sweets, its fur is as sticky sweet as cotton candy.

pokemon.name: Slurpuff
pokemon.description: Its sense of smell is 100 million times better than a human's, so even the faintest scent tells it about everything in the area. It's like it can see with its nose!

pokemon.name: Inkay
pokemon.description: It flashes the light-emitting spots on its body, which drains its opponent's will to fight. It takes the opportunity to scuttle away and hide.

pokemon.name: Malamar
pokemon.description: It lures its prey close with hypnotic motions, then wraps its tentacles around it before finishing it off with digestive fluids.

pokemon.name: Binacle
pokemon.description: They stretch and then contract, yanking their rocks along with them in bold hops. They eat seaweed that washes up on the shoreline.

pokemon.name: Barbaracle
pokemon.description: Barbaracle's legs and hands have minds of their own, and they will move independently. But they usually follow the head's orders.

pokemon.name: Skrelp
pokemon.description: It looks just like rotten kelp. It hides from foes while storing up power for its evolution.

pokemon.name: Dragalge
pokemon.description: Tales are told of ships that wander into seas where Dragalge live, never to return.

pokemon.name: Clauncher
pokemon.description: Through controlled explosions of internal gas, it can expel water like a pistol shot. At close distances, it can shatter rock.

pokemon.name: Clawitzer
pokemon.description: By expelling water from the nozzle in the back of its claw, it can move at a speed of 60 knots.

pokemon.name: Helioptile
pokemon.description: The frills on either side of its head have cells that generate electricity when exposed to sunlight.

pokemon.name: Heliolisk
pokemon.description: It stimulates its muscles with electricity, boosting the strength in its legs and enabling it to run 100 yards in five seconds.

pokemon.name: Tyrunt
pokemon.description: Its immense jaws have enough destructive force that it can chew up an automobile. It lived 100 million years ago.

pokemon.name: Tyrantrum
pokemon.description: Nothing could stop this Pokémon 100 million years ago, so it behaved like a king.

pokemon.name: Amaura
pokemon.description: This calm Pokémon lived in a cold land where there were no violent predators like Tyrantrum.

pokemon.name: Aurorus
pokemon.description: Using its diamond-shaped crystals, it can instantly create a wall of ice to block an opponent's attack.

pokemon.name: Sylveon
pokemon.description: It wraps its ribbonlike feelers around the arm of its beloved Trainer and walks with him or her.

pokemon.name: Hawlucha
pokemon.description: With its wings, it controls its position in the air. It likes to attack from above, a maneuver that is difficult to defend against.

pokemon.name: Dedenne
pokemon.description: It uses its tail to absorb electricity from power plants or from outlets in houses, and then it fires the electricity from its whiskers.

pokemon.name: Carbink
pokemon.description: It has slept underground for hundreds of millions of years since its birth. It's occasionally found during the excavation of caves.

pokemon.name: Goomy
pokemon.description: It's covered in a slimy membrane that makes any punches or kicks slide off it harmlessly.

pokemon.name: Sliggoo
pokemon.description: Its four horns are a high-performance radar system. It uses them to sense sounds and smells, rather than using ears or a nose.

pokemon.name: Goodra
pokemon.description: It attacks with retractable horns. It throws a punch that's the equivalent of the force of a hundred pro boxers.

pokemon.name: Klefki
pokemon.description: It never lets go of a key that it likes, so people give it the keys to vaults and safes as a way to prevent crime.

pokemon.name: Phantump
pokemon.description: According to old tales, these Pokémon are stumps possessed by the spirits of children who died while lost in the forest.

pokemon.name: Trevenant
pokemon.description: Using its roots as a nervous system, it controls the trees in the forest. It's kind to the Pokémon that reside in its body.

pokemon.name: Pumpkaboo
pokemon.description: It is said to carry wandering spirits to the place where they belong so they can move on.

pokemon.name: Gourgeist
pokemon.description: It enwraps its prey in its hairlike arms. It sings joyfully as it observes the suffering of its prey.

pokemon.name: Bergmite
pokemon.description: Using air of -150 degrees Fahrenheit, they freeze opponents solid. They live in herds above the snow line on mountains.

pokemon.name: Avalugg
pokemon.description: The way several Bergmite huddle on its back makes it look like an aircraft carrier made of ice.

pokemon.name: Noibat
pokemon.description: Even a robust wrestler will become dizzy and unable to stand when exposed to its 200,000-hertz ultrasonic waves.

pokemon.name: Noivern
pokemon.description: The ultrasonic waves it emits from its ears can reduce a large boulder to pebbles. It swoops out of the dark to attack.

pokemon.name: Xerneas
pokemon.description: When the horns on its head shine in seven colors, it is said to be sharing everlasting life.

pokemon.name: Yveltal
pokemon.description: When its life comes to an end, it absorbs the life energy of every living thing and turns into a cocoon once more.

pokemon.name: Zygarde
pokemon.description: It's thought to be monitoring the ecosystem. There are rumors that even greater power lies hidden within it.

pokemon.name: Diancie
pokemon.description: It can instantly create many diamonds by compressing the carbon in the air between its hands.

pokemon.name: Hoopa
pokemon.description: It is said to be able to seize anything it desires with its six rings and six huge arms. With its power sealed, it is transformed into a much smaller form.

pokemon.name: Volcanion
pokemon.description: It expels its internal steam from the arms on its back. It has enough power to blow away a mountain.

pokemon.name: Rowlet
pokemon.description: Silently it glides, drawing near its targets. Before they even notice it, it begins to pelt them with vicious kicks.

pokemon.name: Dartrix
pokemon.description: It throws sharp feathers called blade quills at enemies or prey. It seldom misses.

pokemon.name: Decidueye
pokemon.description: Although basically cool and cautious, when it's caught by surprise, it's seized by panic.

pokemon.name: Litten
pokemon.description: It doesn't allow its emotions to be easily seen. Earning its trust takes time. It prefers solitude.

pokemon.name: Torracat
pokemon.description: It boasts powerful front legs. With a single punch, it can bend an iron bar right over.

pokemon.name: Incineroar
pokemon.description: After hurling ferocious punches and flinging furious kicks, it finishes opponents off by spewing fire from around its navel.

pokemon.name: Popplio
pokemon.description: This Pokémon can control water bubbles. It practices diligently so it can learn to make big bubbles.

pokemon.name: Brionne
pokemon.description: It cares deeply for its companions. When its Trainer is feeling down, it performs a cheery dance to try and help.

pokemon.name: Primarina
pokemon.description: Its singing voice is its chief weapon in battle. This Pokémon's Trainer must prioritize the daily maintenance of its throat at all costs.

pokemon.name: Pikipek
pokemon.description: This Pokémon feeds on berries, whose leftover seeds become the ammunition for the attacks it fires off from its mouth.

pokemon.name: Trumbeak
pokemon.description: By bending its beak, it can produce a variety of calls and brand itself a noisy nuisance for its neighbors.

pokemon.name: Toucannon
pokemon.description: Within its beak, its internal gas ignites, explosively launching seeds with enough power to pulverize boulders.

pokemon.name: Yungoos
pokemon.description: It wanders around in a never-ending search for food. At dusk, it collapses from exhaustion and falls asleep on the spot.

pokemon.name: Gumshoos
pokemon.description: It adores having Rattata and Raticate for dinner, but as it's diurnal, it never encounters them. This Pokémon boasts incredible patience.

pokemon.name: Grubbin
pokemon.description: They often gather near places frequented by electric Pokémon in order to avoid being attacked by bird Pokémon.

pokemon.name: Charjabug
pokemon.description: From the food it digests, it generates electricity, and it stores this energy in its electric sac.

pokemon.name: Vikavolt
pokemon.description: It produces electricity via an electrical organ in its abdomen. It overwhelms bird Pokémon with shocking beams of electrical energy.

pokemon.name: Crabrawler
pokemon.description: It punches so much, its pincers often come off from overuse, but they grow back quickly. What little meat they contain is rich and delicious.

pokemon.name: Crabominable
pokemon.description: It just throws punches indiscriminately. In times of desperation, it can lop off its own pincers and fire them like rockets.

pokemon.name: Oricorio
pokemon.description: This Oricorio has sipped red nectar. Its passionate dance moves cause its enemies to combust in both body and mind.

pokemon.name: Cutiefly
pokemon.description: Myriads of Cutiefly flutter above the heads of people who have auras resembling those of flowers.

pokemon.name: Ribombee
pokemon.description: Some of Ribombee's pollen puffs are highly nutritious. They are sometimes sold as supplements.

pokemon.name: Rockruff
pokemon.description: This Pokémon has lived with people since times long ago. It can sense when its Trainer is in the dumps and will stick close by its Trainer's side.

pokemon.name: Lycanroc
pokemon.description: When properly raised from a young age, it will become a trustworthy partner that will absolutely never betray its Trainer.

pokemon.name: Wishiwashi
pokemon.description: It's awfully weak and notably tasty, so everyone is always out to get it. As it happens, anyone trying to bully it receives a painful lesson.

pokemon.name: Mareanie
pokemon.description: It's found crawling on beaches and seafloors. The coral that grows on Corsola's head is as good as a five-star banquet to this Pokémon.

pokemon.name: Toxapex
pokemon.description: Those attacked by Toxapex's poison will suffer intense pain for three days and three nights. Post-recovery, there will be some aftereffects.

pokemon.name: Mudbray
pokemon.description: It has a stubborn, individualistic disposition. Eating dirt, making mud, and playing in the mire all form part of its daily routine.

pokemon.name: Mudsdale
pokemon.description: Its heavy, mud-covered kicks are its best means of attack, and it can reduce large trucks to scrap without breaking a sweat.

pokemon.name: Dewpider
pokemon.description: When it comes across enemies or potential prey, this Pokémon smashes its water-bubble-covered head into them.

pokemon.name: Araquanid
pokemon.description: Despite what its appearance suggests, it cares for others. If it finds vulnerable, weak Pokémon, it protectively brings them into its water bubble.

pokemon.name: Fomantis
pokemon.description: They give off a sweet and refreshing scent. Cutiefly often gather near the tall grass where Fomantis are hiding.

pokemon.name: Lurantis
pokemon.description: It fires beams from its sickle-shaped petals. These beams are powerful enough to cleave through thick metal plates.

pokemon.name: Morelull
pokemon.description: As it drowses the day away, it nourishes itself by sucking from tree roots. It wakens at the fall of night, wandering off in search of a new tree.

pokemon.name: Shiinotic
pokemon.description: It emits flickering spores that cause drowsiness. When its prey succumb to sleep, this Pokémon feeds on them by sucking in their energy.

pokemon.name: Salandit
pokemon.description: Volcanoes or dry, craggy places are its home. It emanates a sweet-smelling poisonous gas that attracts bug Pokémon, then attacks them.

pokemon.name: Salazzle
pokemon.description: Filled with pheromones, its poisonous gas can be diluted to use in the production of luscious perfumes.

pokemon.name: Stufful
pokemon.description: A touch from anyone except a known friend sends it into a surging frenzy. It's an incredibly dangerous Pokémon.

pokemon.name: Bewear
pokemon.description: This Pokémon has the habit of hugging its companions. Many Trainers have left this world after their spines were squashed by its hug.

pokemon.name: Bounsweet
pokemon.description: Although it's too sugary for human consumption, Bounsweet's sweat can be watered down into a juice with just the right amount of sweetness.

pokemon.name: Steenee
pokemon.description: This Pokémon is always bouncing around energetically. Other Pokémon are attracted by its lively appearance and pleasant aroma.

pokemon.name: Tsareena
pokemon.description: A Pokémon known for the beauty of its well-shaped legs, it sometimes appears as a mascot in advertisements for beauty salons.

pokemon.name: Comfey
pokemon.description: Baths prepared with the flowers from its vine have a relaxing effect, so this Pokémon is a hit with many people.

pokemon.name: Oranguru
pokemon.description: Deep in the jungle, high in the lofty canopy, this Pokémon abides. On rare occasions, it shows up at the beach to match wits with Slowking.

pokemon.name: Passimian
pokemon.description: They battle with hard berries for weapons. Their techniques are passed from the boss to the group, generation upon generation.

pokemon.name: Wimpod
pokemon.description: Its habitat varies from beaches to seabeds. A natural scavenger, it will gleefully chow down on anything edible, no matter how rotten.

pokemon.name: Golisopod
pokemon.description: It battles skillfully with its six arms, but spends most of its time peacefully meditating in caves deep beneath the sea.

pokemon.name: Sandygast
pokemon.description: It takes control of anyone who puts a hand in its mouth. And so it adds to the accumulation of its sand-mound body.

pokemon.name: Palossand
pokemon.description: Buried beneath the castle are masses of dried-up bones from those whose vitality it has drained.

pokemon.name: Pyukumuku
pokemon.description: These Pokémon line the beaches. The sticky mucous that covers their bodies can be used to soothe sunburned skin. How convenient!

pokemon.name: Type-Null
pokemon.description: Due to the danger that this synthetic Pokémon may go on a rampage, it wears a control mask to restrain its power.

pokemon.name: Silvally
pokemon.description: Although its name was Type: Null at first, the boy who evolved it into this form gave it the name by which it is now known.

pokemon.name: Minior
pokemon.description: Strong impacts can knock it out of its shell. This Pokémon was born from mutated nanoparticles.

pokemon.name: Komala
pokemon.description: The log it holds was given to it by its parents at birth. It has also been known to cling to the arm of a friendly Trainer.

pokemon.name: Turtonator
pokemon.description: It gushes fire and poisonous gases from its nostrils. Its dung is an explosive substance and can be put to various uses.

pokemon.name: Togedemaru
pokemon.description: The long hairs on its back act as lightning rods. The bolts of lightning it attracts are stored as energy in its electric sac.

pokemon.name: Mimikyu
pokemon.description: A lonely Pokémon, it conceals its terrifying appearance beneath an old rag so it can get closer to people and other Pokémon.

pokemon.name: Bruxish
pokemon.description: It stuns its prey with psychokinesis and then grinds them to mush with its strong teeth. Even Shellder's shell is no match for it.

pokemon.name: Drampa
pokemon.description: This Pokémon is friendly to people and loves children most of all. It comes from deep in the mountains to play with children it likes in town.

pokemon.name: Dhelmise
pokemon.description: The soul of seaweed adrift in the waves became reborn as this Pokémon. It maintains itself with new infusions of seabed detritus and seaweed.

pokemon.name: Jangmo-o
pokemon.description: They live in mountains where no trace of humans can be detected. Jangmo-o grow little by little as they battle one another.

pokemon.name: Hakamo-o
pokemon.description: It sheds and regrows its scales on a continuous basis. The scales become harder and sharper each time they're regrown.

pokemon.name: Kommo-o
pokemon.description: Its rigid scales function as offense and defense. In the past, its scales were processed and used to make weapons and other commodities.

pokemon.name: Tapu-Koko
pokemon.description: It confuses its enemies by flying too quickly for the eye to follow. It has a hair-trigger temper but forgets what made it angry an instant later.

pokemon.name: Tapu-Lele
pokemon.description: As it flutters about, it scatters its strangely glowing scales. Touching them is said to restore good health on the spot.

pokemon.name: Tapu-Bulu
pokemon.description: The guardian deity of Ula'ula is a lazy Pokémon. It commands plants to immobilize its foes and then deals them a savage blow with its horns.

pokemon.name: Tapu-Fini
pokemon.description: The guardian deity of Poni, it can control water. People say it can create pure water that will wash away any uncleanness.

pokemon.name: Cosmog
pokemon.description: In ages past, it was called the child of the stars. It's said to be a Pokémon from another world, but no specific details are known.

pokemon.name: Cosmoem
pokemon.description: There's something accumulating around the black core within its hard shell. People think this Pokémon may come from another world.

pokemon.name: Solgaleo
pokemon.description: This Pokémon is said to be a male evolution of Cosmog. At the activation of its third eye, it departs for another world.

pokemon.name: Lunala
pokemon.description: Said to live in another world, this Pokémon devours light, drawing the moonless dark veil of night over the brightness of day.

pokemon.name: Nihilego
pokemon.description: One of the Ultra Beasts. It's unclear whether or not this Pokémon is sentient, but sometimes it can be observed behaving like a young girl.

pokemon.name: Buzzwole
pokemon.description: A mysterious life-form called an Ultra Beast. Witnesses saw it pulverize a dump truck with a single punch.

pokemon.name: Pheromosa
pokemon.description: One of the Ultra Beasts. It refuses to touch anything, perhaps because it senses some uncleanness in this world.

pokemon.name: Xurkitree
pokemon.description: It appeared from the Ultra Wormhole. It raided a power plant, so people think it energizes itself with electricity.

pokemon.name: Celesteela
pokemon.description: One kind of Ultra Beast. Witnesses have seen it burn down a forest by expelling gas from its two arms.

pokemon.name: Kartana
pokemon.description: One of the Ultra Beast life-forms, it was observed cutting down a gigantic steel tower with one stroke of its blade.

pokemon.name: Guzzlord
pokemon.description: A dangerous Ultra Beast, it appears to be eating constantly, but for some reason its droppings have never been found.

pokemon.name: Necrozma
pokemon.description: Light is apparently the source of its energy. It has an extraordinarily vicious disposition and is constantly firing off laser beams.

pokemon.name: Magearna
pokemon.description: Its mechanized body is merely a vessel. Its true self is its Soul-Heart, an artificial soul.

pokemon.name: Marshadow
pokemon.description: It sinks into the shadows of people and  Pokémon, where it can understand their feelings  and copy their capabilities.

pokemon.name: Poipole
pokemon.description: An Ultra Beast that lives in a different world, it  cackles wildly as it sprays its opponents with  poison from the needles on its head.

pokemon.name: Naganadel
pokemon.description: One kind of Ultra Beast, it fires a glowing,  venomous liquid from its needles. This liquid  is also immensely adhesive.

pokemon.name: Stakataka
pokemon.description: When stone walls started moving and attacking,  the brute's true identity was this mysterious  life-form, which brings to mind an Ultra Beast.

pokemon.name: Blacephalon
pokemon.description: A UB that appeared from an Ultra Wormhole, it  causes explosions, then takes advantage of  opponents' surprise to rob them of their vitality.

pokemon.name: Zeraora
pokemon.description: It approaches its enemies at the speed of lightning, then tears them limb from limb with its sharp claws.

pokemon.name: Meltan
pokemon.description: It melts particles of iron and other metals found in the subsoil, so it can absorb them into its body of molten steel.

pokemon.name: Melmetal
pokemon.description: Revered long ago for its capacity to create iron from nothing, for some reason it has come back to life after 3,000 years.
